content.description: Climb the arete left of Curtain Call.
content.location: Crouch start on the rectangular hold as far left on the arete as you can get (might be hard if water is high, and as of now there’s a giant log blocking you from getting lower). Work up and right on the arete to merge with Curtain Call for the topout.

content.description: Amazing 15 degree overhanging climb if you like crimps.  Start sitting on the lowest holds in the middle of the face and make your way up without using any holds on the aretes. The jug to the right is off, as is everything to the right of that jug. Used to be V10 before heel hook beta was found lowering the grade to V8 (according to latest guide from Robin and Dana)
content.location: Middle of the overhanging face on the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the slab around the corner from Curtain Call and with a low side pull. Establish on the face and work up and left around the corner to jugs on the arete, topping out same as Curtain Call. the start might be difficult depending on water level - if water is high you might want to do a V2 stand start variation
content.location: Sitstart on sidepull located on the slab face around the corner from Curtain Call

content.description: The Curtain Call Boulder is located just before the Long Wall
